description: Our Bachelor’s Programme in Business Administration (BBA) is a full-time, three-year programme (180 ECTS), delivered on-site at the University of Vaasa, Finland’s largest educator of business studies. It prepares you to continue your studies directly at Master’s level (3+2 years). You will study in an international environment, gaining expertise in management, marketing, international business, and industrial management, while tailoring your studies through specialization modules and electives.

The programme provides students with all the necessary tools needed for making decisions and solving problems. It also improves their understanding of the increasingly complex and globalised financial markets. In addition, students will learn analytical approaches and methods for financial analysis. Finance students have access to a Bloomberg Lab, which is a real-world trading room simulation that allows students to monitor and analyse real-time financial markets data.

major: Master's Degree Programme in International Business (MIB)
description: Global business requires graduates who can navigate uncertainty and have a comprehensive understanding of the field. As the need for responsible and sustainable practices of companies, consumers, and societies will continue to grow, our Master’s degree programme in International Business focuses on sustainable global business to meet these challenges.

major: Master’s Programme in Strategic Business Development
description: Are you looking to advance your career in business development and strategy? Master's programme in Strategic Business Development serves as a stepping-stone for your career, equipping you with essential knowledge and practical skills to identify strategic choices, plan successful business opportunities, and implement effective solutions.

major: Industrial Management, Master of Science in Economics and Business Administration
description: Are you eager to bridge the gap between business and technology? Do you have a passion for shaping sustainable processes and advancing the energy sector? If you hold a bachelor’s degree in business administration or technology with a focus on business studies, the Industrial Management major offers a perfect pathway to elevate your career.

major: Master’s Programme in Electrical and Energy Engineering
description: Our Master’s programme in Electrical and Energy Engineering offers students the latest knowledge about the ongoing energy transition and provides excellent capabilities to create future-proof solutions for future sustainable and resilient energy systems.

Our Master’s programme in Computing Sciences educates Masters of Science in Technology and offers the choice of three different majors in English: Automation and Robotics (in Pori), Sustainable and Autonomous Systems, and Artificial Intelligence and Data Engineering.

major: Master’s Programme in Industrial Engineering and Management
description: Our Master’s programme in Industrial Management innovatively brings together engineering and business administration. Whether you are passionate about understanding complex industrial systems, driving successful projects, or integrating business with technology, we have the right studies for you.

Business Studies produce Doctors of Science in Business Administration or Economics for demanding expert and management roles. The University of Vaasa is one of Finland's oldest business studies institutions and it has a long tradition of high-calibre international graduate education.

Doctoral degrees can be completed in the following research fields (main subjects): Automation Technology, Energy Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, Telecommunication Engineering, Industrial Management, Information Systems Science, Statistics, and Business Mathematics.

We produce Doctors of Administrative Sciences and Doctors of Philosophy in Communication Studies for demanding research, expert, education, development and foreperson roles, especially in public sector but also in the private sector and for other actors of society.
